title: Do You See What I See?
description: Everyone sees the world differently. Exactly which colors you see and which of your eyes is doing more work than the other as you read this text is different for everyone. Also different? Our blind spots – both physical and social. As we continue celebrating Black History Month, today we're featuring Exploratorium Staff Physicist Educator Desiré Whitmore. She shines a light on human eyesight – how it affects perception and how understanding another person's view of the world can offer us a fuller, better picture of life.

itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Everyone sees the world differently. Today, scientist Desiré Whitmore explains what physical blind spots can teach us about social blind spots.
